bioghist.p: Elizabeth Olds (1896-1991) was an artist and a writer and illustrator of children's books. She was born in Minneapolis and studied at the Minneapolis Institute of Art from 1918 to 1921. In that year, she moved to New York, where she continued her studies at the Art Students League of New York. During the Depression, she worked for the WPA Federal Art Project's graphic division, and her work from this time focused on the lives of working people. Olds was the first woman to hold a Guggenheim Fellowship in art. During the fellowship, she studied art in Paris. Her works were exhibited in solo shows and group shows over five decades, and she is represented in several museums. Her children's books include The Big Fire, Little Una, Plop Plop Ploppie, and Feather Mountain, which received a Caldecott Honor in 1952.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials related to two of Elizabeth Olds' books: Little Una and Plop, Plop, Ploppie. Little Una materials include illustration and text proofs, galley proofs, author's proofs with correction notes, dummies, color proofs, and woodcut prints of final art. Plop, Plop, Ploppie materials include final art, galley proofs, a dummy, woodblock prints of Ploppie, and a preliminary wash drawing.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
